title: AWS IMMERSION DAY - Maximus
content: AWS Immersion Day is offered to selected customers to provide a deep hands-on experience on the tools and technologies that can address the customer requirements. It would involve presentations, workshops and Q&A with the attendees to discuss and demonstrate the solution.

title: Agenda
content: Schedule for Nov 6th, 2019    Start Time (EST) Duration Training Type Title     09:30am 15 mins Presentation Introduction to AWS DevOps Immersion Day   09:45am 45 mins Presentation Current State of DevOps at Maximus   10:30am 15 mins Q&A Discussions and Q&A   10:45am 15 mins N/A BREAK   11:00am 30 mins Presentation DevOps @ Amazon.com   11:30am 30 mins Presentation Module1: Building CI/CD pipeline with AWS Fargate   12:00pm 1 hour Present / Demo LUNCH N LEARN   01:00pm 15 mins N/A BREAK   01:15pm 1 hour 15 mins LAB Module1: Building CI/CD pipeline with AWS Fargate   02:30pm 15 mins N/A BREAK   02:45pm 1 Hour 15 mins LAB Module2: Integration of Jenkins with CodeBuild and CodeDeploy (Jenkins, Github)   04:00pm 15 mins Presentation Closing   04:15pm 15 mins Survey Survey

title: Workshop Login
content: Logging into AWS Console It is encouraged to work in a team of no more than 4 person with an ideal number of 2-3. The teams will be provided with Team-Hashes, with which the members can login into Event Engine.  Steps to follow:  Login URL: Click Here Enter the team hash and on next screen, enter a "Cool" Team Name The dashboard will now look like this, click on the "AWS Console" (circled) :  Copy-paste the credentials in your notepad for our workshop use. The example below shows "us-east-2" region, but please co-ordinate with the admin to note down the correct region. Click on Open Console highlighted to login into AWS account:  You would see the AWS Account as below now, you can now move to the workshop :  Now move on to the Module1 section and commence the workshop !! ENJOY !!

title: Module 1
content: Building CI/CD Pipeline with AWS Fargate This workshop provides an hands-on experience in instantiating a typical web hosting infrastructure that hosts applications being deployed from a CI/CD pipeline. The application is containerized and deployed on Serverless Infrastructure.  Please access this workshop at this link

title: Module 2
content: Jenkins orchestration with AWS CodeBuild and CodeDeploy This workshop provides a hands-on experience in building a Jenkins orchestrated CI/CD pipeline with AWS CodeBuild and AWS CodeDeploy services to deploy a monolith application on a typical web-hosting EC2 infrastructure.  Please access this workshop at this link

title: Survey
content: Please fill the survey at this link. Your feedback would be valuable.
